author: Doctor Strange

text:
Sugiyama's pretty much a musical genius. To make the obligatory Uematsu comparison (I love his work, too), I feel they're equally strong and influential composers, but I prefer Sugiyama's classical, atmospheric approach over Uematsu's more modern, "active" style. That's just me, though.

Also, this particular soundfont makes me think of Chrono Trigger blended with Final Fantasy V...good stuff.

author: ManfredMitchum

text: Thank you for this recommendation....I thought I was the only person on Earth who liked this game and its music.
author: ManfredMitchum

text:
I know your list consists of music from games you've played so rather than suggest you just listen to the song and put up something, I'm going to suggest a game.
Pacman World 2. I loved the game, still do, and one of the strongest reasons is the music is amazing. It's on Gamecube PS2 and Xbox so it should be a simpler get although finding may be hard, I don't know. Fun game, great music. I think it's worth your time.
Thanks if you respond. And thanks for taking the time to read this.
